intro: Crepidomanes novoguineense, commonly known as the New Guinea crepidomanes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its structure includes a woody stem with alternate leaves and small, capsule-like fruits. The botanical features of this plant make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
